titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that the United States should seek a final and conclusive account of the whereabouts and definitive fate of Raoul Wallenberg.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.

bill.summary: 1/4/1995--Introduced. Acknowledges the cooperation of the Soviet and now Russian authorities in providing records and personal effects of Raoul Wallenberg to his family. Requests that: (1) the President pursue, through diplomatic discussions with the Government of the Russian Federation, an investigation into the whereabouts and fate of Raoul Wallenberg; and (2) the results of this investigation be made public.
